meanings.definition: A person who adheres to strict adherence to the law.
meanings.sent1: The legalists in the courtroom always followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The legalists argued for the importance of obeying every law.
meanings.sent3: The legalists at the library insisted on returning books on time.
meanings.sent4: In the land of legalists, even jaywalking was considered a serious offense.
meanings.sent5: The image of the legalists meticulously studying every legal document stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: Those who emphasize strict adherence to the law.
meanings.sent1: Among the legalists, the focus was always on upholding the law.
meanings.sent2: The legalists' group meeting revolved around discussing legal codes.
meanings.sent3: The legalists' picnic featured a 'lawful eating only' rule.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a legalist, always reminding her to follow the rules.
meanings.sent5: The legalists' dedication to the law was unwavering and admirable.

meanings.definition: The belief in strict adherence to the law.
meanings.sent1: The community's legalists strongly believed in following every regulation.
meanings.sent2: Legalists' philosophy class delved into the importance of law obedience.
meanings.sent3: The legalists' dance party had a 'lawful moves only' theme.
meanings.sent4: In the world of legalists, even minor infractions were not tolerated.
meanings.sent5: The concept of legalists' commitment to the law was deeply ingrained in their culture.
